entities.descriptionEnglish: The One God, Lord of all creation

entities.descriptionArabic: اسم من أسماء الله تعالى يدل على وحدانيته المطلقة، لا نظير ولا شبيه ولا عديل له
entities.descriptionEnglish: A name of Allah indicating His absolute oneness — He has no peer, no likeness, and no equal

entities.descriptionArabic: السيد الذي كمل في سؤدده، الذي يصمد إليه الخلائق في حوائجهم، الذي لا جوف له
entities.descriptionEnglish: The Master who is perfect in His sovereignty, to whom all creation turns in need, the Self-Sufficient who has no hollow

entities.descriptionArabic: خاتم الأنبياء والمرسلين، أُمر بتبليغ التوحيد الخالص
entities.descriptionEnglish: The final Prophet and Messenger, commanded to convey pure monotheism

entities.descriptionArabic: إفراد الله بالألوهية والعبادة، وتنزيهه عن الولد والوالد والكفء
entities.descriptionEnglish: The absolute oneness of Allah in divinity and worship, free from offspring, parentage, or equal

entities.descriptionArabic: كمال الله في ذاته وصفاته واستغناؤه عن الخلق مع افتقارهم إليه
entities.descriptionEnglish: Allah's perfection in His essence and attributes, His independence from creation while all creation depends on Him

entities.descriptionArabic: تنزيه الله عما لا يليق به من الولد والوالد والشبيه والنظير
entities.descriptionEnglish: Declaring Allah free from what is unbefitting — offspring, parentage, likeness, or equal

entities.descriptionArabic: كتاب الله المنزل على محمد ﷺ، سورة الإخلاص تعدل ثلثه
entities.descriptionEnglish: The Book of Allah revealed to Muhammad ﷺ; Surah Al-Ikhlas equals one-third of it

entities.descriptionArabic: الذين طلبوا من النبي ﷺ أن ينسب لهم ربه فنزلت سورة الإخلاص
entities.descriptionEnglish: Those who asked the Prophet ﷺ to describe his Lord's lineage, prompting the revelation of Surah Al-Ikhlas

entities.descriptionArabic: الذين قالوا نعبد عزيراً ابن الله
entities.descriptionEnglish: Those who said they worship Uzayr (Ezra) as a son of God

entities.descriptionArabic: الذين قالوا نعبد المسيح ابن الله
entities.descriptionEnglish: Those who said they worship the Messiah as a son of God

entities.descriptionArabic: نزلت رداً على المشركين حين طلبوا من النبي ﷺ أن ينسب لهم ربه
entities.descriptionEnglish: Revealed in response to the polytheists who asked the Prophet ﷺ to describe his Lord's lineage

entities.descriptionArabic: صحابي جليل، روى سبب نزول سورة الإخلاص
entities.descriptionEnglish: Noble Companion, narrated the cause of revelation of Surah Al-Ikhlas

relationships.description: Al-Ahad (The One) is an attribute and name of Allah affirming His absolute uniqueness
As-Samad (The Eternal Refuge) is an attribute and name of Allah affirming His self-sufficiency and perfection
Tawhid is expressed through the affirmation that Allah is Al-Ahad (The One)
Divine Self-Sufficiency is expressed through the name As-Samad
Tanzih negates offspring, parentage, and any equal from Allah
The Quran was revealed to Prophet Muhammad ﷺ
The polytheists' demand to describe Allah's lineage caused the revelation of this surah
The polytheists rejected pure monotheism by worshipping idols
The Jews deviated from pure monotheism by claiming Uzayr is the son of God
The Christians deviated from pure monotheism by claiming the Messiah is the son of God
Allah commanded Muhammad ﷺ to say 'He is Allah, the One'

relationships.context: Allah is declared to be The One (Ahad) — absolute uniqueness with no peer or likeness
The name Al-Ahad is explicitly stated — He is unique, not applied to anyone else in the affirmative
The foundational declaration of pure monotheism: 'Say: He is Allah, the One'
Commanded to proclaim Allah's oneness with 'Say (Qul)'
Asked the Prophet to describe his Lord's lineage, prompting this revelation
The surah was revealed in response to demands to describe Allah's lineage
Narrated the hadith about the cause of revelation
Surah Al-Ikhlas equals one-third of the Quran in reward
As-Samad is stated as Allah's attribute — the Self-Sufficient to whom all creation turns
Divine Self-Sufficiency: Allah is As-Samad — perfect, self-sufficient, without hollow
Allah is free from having offspring ('He begets not'), parents ('nor was He begotten'), or equals
Allah is As-Samad, did not beget nor was begotten, and has no equal
Their claim that Uzayr is son of God is implicitly refuted by 'He begets not'
Their claim that the Messiah is son of God is implicitly refuted by 'He begets not'
